monogr.title: The holie historie of our Lord and Sauiour Iesus Christs natiuitie, life, actes, miracles, doctrine, death, passion, resurrection and ascension : gathered into English meeter, and published to withdraw vaine wits from all vnsauerie and wicked rimes and fables, to some lou and liking of spirituall songs and holy scriptures. By Robert Holland maister of Arts, and minister of the Church of Prendergast
monogr.author: Holland, Robert

div.head: TO THE GODLY and Christian Reader.
div.p: GEntle Reader, I thinke my labour well bestowed if the same may benefite any, and my reward sufficient, if the godly like and allowe of my booke. I must confesse, and do, that this worke would haue required one of greater reading and of farre deeper iudgement then my selfe to vndertake it: neither can I any way make thee amends for my rashnesse herein, vnlesse thou accept of my good will, for the recompence.

Many will mislike with it, because it is in meeter (Beza. Georg. Fabr • hist. de nat. pa • & resur. Chr • carmina. Barthol. Freu • celij od. sacra • lib. 3. de inca • reb. gestis, & 〈◊〉 Christi. Witt • berg. an. 159 • 1. Cor. 2.2. though sundrie haue done the like in Latine verse:) and many with the meeter, because it is rudely handled. The first I hope will excuse me, if they consider that I seeke not herein to set foorth my selfe to the shew, but as much as I may to win if not many, yet some, to know Christ Iesus crucified. Although this historie is so briefe and plaine in the writings of the foure Euangelistes, as no mortall man may presume to amend it: and that many worthy and famous men, both
for their learning and knowledge, haue in sundrie languages commented at large, and made verie godly and profitable expositions vpon the same: yet hath it not wonne all men to such liking thereof, that they can affoord much time to reade the one or the other. If I may any way satisfie such, and hereby draw them to sauour of the Sauiour, our Lord Iesus Christ, I shall thinke my time well spent, and my selfe not deceiued of my desire. Which reckening of mine if it be allowed for good payment of my godly hostesse, I meane the Christian congregation and church of God: there shall none of the children of Belial, the brood of darknesse, driue me to anie new accompts. I care not who carpe at it, so that Christ may be glorified by it, and the Christian and godly Reader satisfied with it: to whose censure I submit it and my selfe, humbly desiring the learned with fauour to find out all faults, & charitably to amend where I haue mist. Farewell.

closer.signed: Thine in the Lord Iesus, R. Holland.
